intro: Greenea corymbosa var. siamensis, commonly known as the Siam greenea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form with opposite, elliptical leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its ornamental value comes from its dense foliage and showy inflorescences. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates with high humidity and well-drained soil.
